title: Schwabacher
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902095518/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Blackletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902095518/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Blackletter) : Schwabacher**

A substyle of [Blackletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902095518/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Blackletter) type, probably first developed in Germany around 1470. Schwabacher is more open, wide, and rounder than the earlier [Textura](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902095518/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Textura), as well as less standard and less ornate than the later [Fraktur](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902095518/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fraktur).
author: dan_reynolds
